# Mohr circle parameters

calculates parameters of the Mohr circle

## Usage

``` r
Mohr_calc(
  sigma_x = NA,
  sigma_z = NA,
  tau_xz = NA,
  sigma1 = NA,
  sigma3 = NA,
  theta = seq(from = 0, to = 180, by = 1)
)
```

## Arguments

- sigma_x:

  numeric. Magnitude of normal stress acting in the horizontal direction

- sigma_z:

  numeric. Magnitude of normal stress acting in the vertical direction

- tau_xz:

  numeric. Magnitude of shear stress acting on the same plane as
  `"sigma_x"`

- sigma1:

  numeric. Magnitude of major principal stress

- sigma3:

  numeric. Magnitude of minor principal stress

- theta:

  numeric. Angles (degrees); defaults to 0-180 in increments of 1

## Value

A five-element list containing

- `"mean"`:

  center of Mohr circle, i.e. the mean stress

- `"deviatoric"`:

  radius of Mohr circle, i.e. the deviatoric stress

- `"sigma"`:

  vector of normal stresses for Mohr circle

- `"tau"`:

  vector of shear stresses for Mohr circle

- `"theta"`:

  vector of angles (degrees)

## Details

If theta is entered in conjunction with `"sigma_x"`, `"sigma_z"`, and
`"tau_xz"`, it is interpreted as the angle of inclination above the
horizontal. If `"theta"` is entered in conjunction with the principal
stresses, then it is interpreted as the angle of inclination above the
major principal plane.

## Note

One of the following two sets of data must be entered

1.  `"sigma_x"`, `"sigma_z"`, `"tau_xz"`

2.  `"sigma1"`, `"sigma3"`

## See also

[`Mohr_plot()`](https://tobiste.github.io/structr/reference/Mohr_plot.md)

## Author

Kyle Elmy and Jim Kaklamanos

## Examples

``` r
Mohr_calc(sigma_x = 80, sigma_z = 120, tau_xz = 20)
```
